intro: Chrysosplenium funiushanensis, commonly known as the Funiushan saponaria, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Saxifragaceae family and is characterized by its basal rosette of lanceolate leaves. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered an endangered species.
